name: voracity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact that an animal or a person wants to eat a large amount of food: The requirement for prey depended on the voracity of the beetles. The young insects feed with astonishing voracity.
the state of being very eager to have a lot of something: The scale and voracity of his betting was shocking. There were rumours about his sexual voracity.
More examplesFewer examplesThe voracity of the seals creates a problem - the fish cannot breed faster than the seals can eat them.More important was the voracity with which he devoured mathematics.
